title: Quantum tunneling in a quintessence background and the role of GUP
abstract:
In this paper we studied quantum tunneling of massless and massive particles
pertaining to a Schwarzschild black hole in a quintessence background, and
explored the consequences emerging from a generalized uncertainty principle
(GUP). For the quintessence scenario, we considered two specific cases of $w$,
which is the ratio of the pressure and energy density, namely $w=-1/3$ and
$w=-2/3$. For the GUP, we used a modified Schwarzschild metric and employed a
unique choice of contour integration to compute the tunneling amplitudes. An
analysis and comparative study of the respective temperature profiles have been
made.
